project.name: Safelink
project.description: SafeLink is an open-source NodeJS library created to maintain long-term communication between distant remote sites with varying network quality

Agent.name: Agent
Agent.description: Primary client-side abstraction used to establish and manage communication with a central dispatcher

Dispatcher.name: Dispatcher
Dispatcher.description:
The dispatcher is responsible for central coordination of all agents. It monitors their liveness and make sure they can communication between one and other.
The Dispatcher is an {EventEmitter} and will make sure events are remotely replicated between agents.

WatchDog.name: WatchDog
WatchDog.description:
Each instance is responsible for monitoring the state of a single agent. If we don't receive heartbeat at regular intervals,
the watchdog will emit an agent-disconnected event to reset the agent communication.

params.name: agent
params.description: An agent object (with id) to watch

params.name: dispatcher
params.description: The dispatcher hosting this watchdog

Abstract an agent subscription for various custom events. Each event will be broadcast to the agent
as they are received by the dispatcher through the standard emit method.

Copyright 2013 Joel Grenon
Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
 you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
 You may obtain a copy of the License at
http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
 distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
 WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
 See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
 limitations under the License.

Copyright 2013 Joel Grenon

params.name: options
params.description:
Supported options are :
  - waitForDispatcher: Indicate if the agent will exit of retry connection with the dispatcher indefinitely. Default to false.

classitems.name: before-connect
classitems.description: Fired before the agent is connected to the dispatcher.

classitems.name: connected
classitems.description:
Fired when the dispatcher has been reached and accepted our initial connection request. The response
 to the connect call is passed in parameter

params.name: response
params.description: The response of the connect call as sent by the dispatcher

classitems.name: subscribeTo
classitems.description:
Will connect this agent with remote events emitted by the dispatcher. These events may be triggered by the dispatcher or other agents connected
 on the network. For now, you can only subscribe to events that are sent to you, but in the future, we will add support for channels to receive 'room-like' messages.

params.name: key
params.description: The event key we wish to subscribe to remotely

params.name: fn
params.description: The handler that will be called when the event is triggered remotely

params.name: options
params.description:
Options modifying the behavior to the function.

 - **force** : Avoid reusing a subscription if already in place and
 send the request to the dispatcher anyway. This is used when the dispatcher just failed and we are instructed to reconnect our event handlers.

classitems.name: broadcast
classitems.description:
Send a notification to whomever is listening to. This is not directed to a specific agent, but to anyone
 on the network, including the dispatcher.

params.name: event
params.description: The key identifying the event

params.name: payload
params.description: The event data

params.name: options
params.description: Options modifying the behavior of the broadcast.

return.description: A promise resolved as soon as the event has been broadcasted. Nothing is returned (fire and forget)

classitems.name: execute
classitems.description:
Execute a remote command. Depending on the dispatcher context, the command might be executed by
the dispatcher itself or by another agent, having registered a remote command handler with the dispacher.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the command to execute. It must be registered by the dispatcher or an agent somewhere to receive a response.

params.name: payload
params.description: The data to send with the command.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options that may change the way the command is executed. Supported options are:

- **timeout** : The number of seconds to wait for a response. Default to 30 seconds.

return.description: A promise for the command result.

classitems.name: executeOn
classitems.description: Execute a remote command on a specific agent. The command will be forward directly to this agent.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the command to execute. It must be registered by the dispatcher or an agent somewhere to receive a response.

params.name: payload
params.description: The data to send with the command.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options that may change the way the command is executed. Supported options are:

- **timeout** : The number of seconds to wait for a response. Default to 30 seconds.

return.description: A promise for the command result.

params.name: agentId
params.description: One or more agentIds that should receive this event.

params.name: event
params.description: The key of the event to send

params.name: payload
params.description: Data that will be associated with this event.

params.name: options
params.description: Options that will affect the way the event is emitted

classitems.name: registerCommandHandler
classitems.description: Add or replace a command handler. This handler will be execute each time a command of type **key** will be received.

params.name: key
params.description: The command key to attach this handler

params.name: fn
params.description: The handler that will be executed when a command of the specified key is received

classitems.name: network-error
classitems.description: Emitted when there is a network problem and we were unable to communicate with the dispatcher.

params.name: action
params.description: The name of the action that triggered the error

params.name: error
params.description: The actual error that was thrown

classitems.name: dispatch
classitems.description: Helper used to package a command to the dispatcher. Will apply the right format and properly handle results, including errors.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback that will be called when we receive the result (or error)

classitems.description:

classitems.name: internal.db.error
classitems.description: Triggered if the internal Redis database cannot be accessed.

params.name: e
params.description: The error that has been sent.

classitems.name: listen
classitems.description: Connect the HTTP server to the configured port.

return.description: Resolved when the dispatcher is ready to receive commands.

classitems.name: listPendingCommands
classitems.description: List all pending commands for a specific agent

params.name: agentId
params.description: An agentId

return.description:
A list of pending commands. Each command has the following fields:

- id
- agentId
- defer: The deferred result
- status: the status of the command : PENDING | ACTIVE | COMPLETE
- ts : The unix timestamp when this command was created

classitems.name: executeOnAgent
classitems.description: Execute a command on a specific agent

params.name: agentId
params.description: The agentId where the command will be executed

params.name: commandKey
params.description: The command key that identified this command

params.name: payload
params.description: The data that will be passed with the command

return.description: A promise providing access to the command result when available.

classitems.name: emitTo
classitems.description: Emit an event to a specific agent only.

params.name: agentId
params.description: The agent where the event is to be sent. This may be an array of agentIds.

params.name: key
params.description: The event key that is being sent

params.name: data
params.description: The event payload

return.description: A promise resolved when the event has been retrieved by the agent (or agents)
